examples.sentence: I hailed a cab using Didi Dache in 0.3 seconds during rush hour.
The cab driver knew every hutong in Beijing like his own palm.
Tourists enjoy romantic rides in horse-drawn cabs around Central Park.
The cab's wheels made crunching sounds on the cobblestone street.
We cabbed to the opera house to avoid subway transfers.
After midnight revellers cabbed home through neon-lit streets.
The cab stand near Beijing Hotel always has long queues.
My cab fare from Pudong Airport cost a week's lunch money.
The Illuminati is often portrayed as a shadowy cabal in movies.
Ancient alchemists formed cabals to protect their recipes.
The Watergate scandal revealed a presidential cabal.
Twitter users love to expose celebrity cabals.
Politicians caballed behind closed doors before the vote.
The CEOs were caught caballing against labor unions.
Disgruntled generals formed a cabal to overthrow the government.
The board members caballed against the founder.
The caballero tipped his hat to ladies with perfect Cervantes-style manners.
As a true caballero, he always pays for the entire table's tapas.
Don Quixote imagined himself as a caballero fighting windmills.
The caballeros in armor still parade during Toledo's medieval festivals.
The caballero performed breathtaking equestrian stunts at the feria.
Every Andalusian caballero learns to ride before he can walk.
The novel describes a caballero andante traveling through La Mancha.
The Moulin Rouge is the most famous cabaret in Paris, where tourists queue for hours to see the can-can dance.
He proposed to her at a dimly lit cabaret while jazz musicians played 'La Vie en Rose'.
The cabaret at this Berlin club features aerial silk performers and fire-eaters.
Modern cabaret often blends burlesque with political satire, like a spicy hotpot of entertainment.
The Shanghai cabaret show recreates 1930s Shanghai style with qipao-clad singers.
As a cabaret singer, she mastered the art of whispering jazz standards while balancing a champagne glass on her head.
The street vendor chopped cabbage with lightning speed for hotpot ingredients.
Her homemade kimchi uses three types of cabbage for extra crunch.
Children mistook the cabbage patch for giant green roses.
The Polish restaurant's stuffed cabbage tastes like grandma's recipe.
The Victorian cabbie tipped his hat to the ladies.
Cabbies in London used to carry hay for their horses.
The New York cabbie knew every shortcut in Manhattan.
My cabbie told me hilarious stories about midnight fares.
The cabby knew every shortcut in Beijing like the back of his hand.
A Shanghai cabby once drove me across the city for just 50 yuan during a typhoon.
Victorian cabbies wore top hats and carried whips.
The cabby shouted 'Whoa!' as his horse stopped abruptly near Hyde Park.
My chatty cabby explained Chengdu's history while weaving through traffic.
The influencer's log cabin went viral for its minimalist design.
Mushroom-shaped cabins are trending in rural tourism.
Economy cabin passengers can now pre-order bubble tea on flights.
The first-class cabin turns into a mahjong room after dinner.
The writer cabinned himself for three months to finish the novel.
During quarantine, we're all essentially cabinned in our homes.
Cabin crew members now demonstrate TikTok dances for safety instructions.
After 14-day quarantine, everyone in our compound got cabin fever.
The antique medicine cabinet still smells of herbs from 1920s Shanghai.
Her makeup cabinet is organized like a museum display.
The new cabinet members took group photos with Peking Opera faces.
During the crisis, the cabinet met in an underground bunker.
Cabinet reshuffles are more dramatic than Korean dramas.
The cabinet decision triggered memes across social media.
This cabinet-grade mahogany costs more per kg than beef.
The cabinet maker carved moon gates into the wardrobe doors.
Her kitchen cabinet holds 50 types of chili sauce.
The shadow cabinet rehearses debates like stand-up comedians.
The cabinetmaker restored the antique mahogany desk using traditional techniques.
As a cabinetmaker, she specializes in minimalist Scandinavian designs.
The cabinetmaker spent three months carving intricate floral patterns on this wardrobe.
Unlike carpenters, cabinetmakers focus on precise joinery without nails.
The Ming-style chair was crafted by a 70-year-old master cabinetmaker.
The cat chewed through my laptop charging cable again.
Fiber optic cables carry TikTok videos at light speed.
The Titanic sent distress cables before sinking.
In 1866, the first transatlantic cable changed global communication.
Tourists scream when the cable car sways over the canyon.
The suspension bridge's main cable is thicker than a giant panda.
The elevator cable snapped in the action movie scene.
Yachts are secured to the dock with steel cables.
Marconi cabled across the Atlantic in 1901.
Before emails, people cabled urgent messages.
The embassy cabled the evacuation order.
Reporters cabled breaking news in Morse code.
Workers cabled the Christmas tree to the roof of the car.
The kidnapper cabled the victim to a chair.
My grandma still pays for cable TV to watch Peking opera.
Her cable knit sweater smells like mothballs.
The cabling in this old building needs urgent upgrading to support 5G networks.
Hidden cabling behind walls is like the nervous system of a smart home.
The studio's cabling was so tangled it looked like a bowl of instant noodles.
Fiber optic cabling has replaced copper wires in most data centers.
Structured cabling makes office relocation as easy as Lego blocks.
The cabling work delayed by two weeks because workers kept getting tangled in wires.
The yellow cabriolet speeding along the coast looked like a moving sunflower.
Her dream was to cruise California's Highway 1 in a vintage cabriolet.
The cabriolet roof retracts in just 15 seconds - faster than making instant noodles!
The fox's cache was found under a pile of autumn leaves.
Pirates used this cave as a cache for stolen spices.
Squirrels' nut caches help forests grow naturally.
The explorer survived winter with his cache of dried meat.
The spy cached microfilms inside a hollowed-out book.
Grandma caches her savings in different cookie jars.
Bears cache in fat reserves before hibernation.
Your phone's cache memory makes apps load faster.

examples.sentence: The imperial cachet on this document proves its authenticity.
Breaking the cachet on liquor bottles is every child's temptation.
His personal cachet with a dragon design is famous among collectors.
The wax cachet melted when exposed to Beijing's summer heat.
That red ribbon is the cachet of premium Wuliangye liquor.
The panda-shaped cachet distinguishes authentic Sichuan peppercorns.
Peking University's cachet helps graduates land dream jobs.
The cachet of Huawei's engineer team is globally recognized.
The Year of Rabbit cachet made this stamp collection valuable.
Tourists queue for hours to get the Great Wall cachet.
Didi's safety upgrade now has real cachet among users.
Jack Ma's speech lent cachet to the entrepreneurship competition.
Grandma's cackling while watching Xiaohongshu comedy videos shakes the sofa.
The AI voice assistant suddenly started cackling like a hen.
The live-streamer kept cackling about her new lipstick shade for 20 minutes.
Aunties cackling over mahjong tiles sounded like a parrot convention.
The villain's cackling laughter in the drama made viewers mute their TVs.
The cackle of hens echoed through the morning market.
His cackle sounded like a malfunctioning printer.
The villain's cackle sent shivers down my spine.
Her cackle could be heard three tables away in the hotpot restaurant.
The tea house was full of the cackle of retired uncles.
Her cackle with neighbors lasted longer than the Spring Festival Gala.
The geese cackled angrily at the delivery robot.
Chickens cackle loudly after laying eggs, like announcing a major achievement.
The aunties cackled while watching the dating show.
He cackled like a villain when his meme went viral.
The livestream host cackled nonstop about double eleven discounts.
My math teacher cackled through the entire class like a human radio.
The boss said 'cut the cackle' when we discussed milk tea brands.

examples.sentence: The cacophonous mix of construction noise and car horns made my headache worse.
His cacophonous attempt at singing Peking opera scared the neighbor's cat.
The cacophonous debate in parliament sounded like a poultry market.
That cacophonous heavy metal band actually uses farm tools as instruments.
Her cacophonous laughter during the serious meeting was like nails on a chalkboard.

examples.sentence: The cacophony of nails on a chalkboard made everyone cringe.
His attempt at opera singing resulted in pure cacophony.
The avant-garde composer deliberately used cacophony in the symphony.
The cacophony of car horns during rush hour was unbearable.
The cacophony of the construction site next door ruined my Zoom meeting.
A sudden cacophony of fireworks startled the sleeping baby.

examples.sentence: The cactus in my dorm survived 3 months without water, just like my love life.
She collects cactus-shaped USB drives, calling them 'the least prickly cacti'.
The cocktail with cactus juice turned my tongue slightly blue - totally Instagram worthy!
That cad promised marriage but ran away with her savings.
In Victorian novels, cads often wear fancy mustaches.
Modern architects use CAD to design skyscrapers that look like giant dumplings.
Learning CAD is as essential for engineers as chopsticks are for eating noodles.
This CAD software can render your blueprint in 3D while you drink bubble tea.
The forensic team examined the cadaver under purple LED lights.
Medical students nicknamed their practice cadaver 'Professor Bones'.
The cadaver dissection class smells like formalin and courage.
After pulling three all-nighters, his face looked cadaverous under the office lights.
The vampire in the drama appeared with cadaverous makeup that scared children.
The abandoned hospital had a cadaverous smell that made people gag.
Her cadaverous thinness after the diet shocked her friends.

examples.sentence: The golf champion tipped his caddie with a limited edition Rolex.
Smart caddies can calculate wind speed using grass blades.
He caddied for Tiger Woods during his college summer break.
Many golf pros started by caddying at country clubs.
The robotic caddie cart follows players like a loyal duckling.
Trout fishermen often use artificial caddis flies as bait.
The caddis larvae build protective cases from tiny stones.
She keeps her jewelry in a silver caddy shaped like a panda.
The carpenter made a wooden caddy for chess pieces.
The antique caddy preserves pu'er tea's aroma perfectly.
He accidentally broke the lid of his grandmother's porcelain tea caddy.
The cadence of ancient Chinese poems makes them sound like songs.
Her voice had the cadence of a lullaby when reading bedtime stories.
Peking opera performers master the cadence of every syllable.
The cadence of his southern accent made his speech musical.
The cadence of this folk song imitates flowing water.
WeChat voice messages often capture the unique cadence of laughter.
The cadence of typing sounds like raindrops on the roof.
Drummers control the cadence of the entire marching band.
The grandma danced with cadence to the square music.

examples.sentence: The cadet polished his boots until they reflected his determined face.
Cadets at Whampoa Military Academy famously ate breakfast in 3 minutes flat.
Our school's cadet corps won the national drill competition.
The disheveled man cadged for coins near the subway station.
In Victorian London, children often cadged by singing carols.
He cadged a cigarette from the convenience store clerk.
My roommate always cadges my charging cable without asking.
Street vendors cadged counterfeit handbags to tourists.
In 1920s Chicago, gangsters cadged illegal alcohol.
Stop cadging off your parents' Netflix account!
